main_definition: Ordering refers to the act of requesting, arranging, or organizing something in a particular sequence or manner.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Requesting items at a restaurant or store
meanings_and_examples.example: When I went out for dinner, I ordered a steak and potatoes.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Arranging objects in a specific order
meanings_and_examples.example: She organized her books on the shelf by genre and alphabetically within each genre.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Deciding or determining something with authority
meanings_and_examples.example: The manager ordered everyone to wear safety gear while operating heavy machinery.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Setting up a sequence in which tasks will be performed
meanings_and_examples.example: The construction project requires ordering the work by first demolishing the old structure, then erecting new walls, and finally installing electrical systems.
